result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew G. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 1:58 pm
Includes 15CF224 and 15CF403.
Clerk: Kassidi. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dave Casey;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CF224:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent/Deliver Narcotics-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>> Dismiss the Repeater Enhancer.

15CF403:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal-Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
  
PLEA: 
15CF224:
Ct. 3 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>>GUILTY.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF224:
Ct. 3 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>> 8 months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment, Court Costs. No objection to EMP. COURT finds 32 days credit. Concurrent to Ct. 4.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>> 8 months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment, Court Costs. No objection to EMP. COURT finds 32 days credit. Concurrent to Ct. 3.


Adjourned: 2:05 pm
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Case Called: 8:30 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Dave Casey. Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing and Motion Hearing for modification of bond. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY
Attorney Casey makes arguments to bond. 
COURT GRANTS motion to modify bond. 
NEW BOND- $5,000.00 signature bond with the first $100.00 in cash. CONDITIONS: ATTIC for day report and same conditions as previous bond. 
Adj: 8:34 a.m.
Preliminary Hearing on April 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Case Called: 9:36am. Clerk: Denise. Reserve Judge Thomas Cane for Judge Lamont Jacobson. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and prose. Matter set for Prelim. State indicates Public Defender has not appointed yet and this is the 3rd time trying to have Prelim. State indicates that Detective DeNovi has been present for all 3 Prelims. Crt addresses Defendant regarding Public Defender - has been in custody since 3/10/15. Crt addresses Defendant re: time limits. Crt tolls time limits. Defendant requests bail reduction. Crt states BR 2 to hear matter. DATES: Calendar Call 4/7/15 @ 1pm. BR 2. CC: BR 2. Adjourned: 9:39am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:41 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se. 
Date and time was set for preliminary hearing. 
State notes hearing was reset from 3/18/2015 to allow time for public defender's office to appoint counsel. State notes conversation with the PD's office indicating they are still in the process of appointing an attorney for the deft. 
COURT continues tolling of time limits to allow the deft to have representation. 
Prelim reset for 4/1/2015 at 9:30 am in Br. 3. 
Adj: 10:43 am 

cc: Br. 2

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:23 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody without counsel. 
Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing. PD office is to appoint an Attorney to defendant. 
COURT tolls time limits. 
Preliminary Hearing 03/25/15 at 10:30 a.m. in Br.3. 
PTC- 03/25/15 at 1:25 p.m. in Br.2 office. 
Defendant addresses court and requests a bond modification. 
COURT denies bond modification. 
Bond is continued.
